name: openbrowser
description: AI-powered browser automation that lets Claude control web browsers to complete tasks autonomously
long_description:
OpenBrowser is a powerful extension that enables Claude to control real web browsers through an AI agent. It can navigate websites, fill forms, extract data, and perform complex multi-step tasks autonomously. Perfect for web scraping, testing, research, and automation workflows.

### Key Features:
- **Autonomous AI Agent**: High-level task execution with minimal supervision
- **Direct Browser Control**: Navigate, click, type, and interact with any website
- **Content Extraction**: Smart extraction of structured data from web pages
- **Tab Management**: Handle multiple tabs and complex workflows
- **Vision Capabilities**: Use screenshots for visual understanding
- **Security Features**: Domain restrictions and secure execution

### Use Cases:
- Web scraping and data extraction
- Automated testing and QA
- Research and information gathering
- Form filling and submissions
- Multi-step workflow automation

tools.name: browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate to a URL in the current tab or open a new tab. Example: Navigate to https://example.com

tools.name: browser_click
tools.description: Click on an element by its index from browser_get_state. Supports opening links in new tabs

tools.name: browser_type
tools.description: Type text into an input field identified by its index. Use after browser_get_state to find inputs

tools.name: browser_get_state
tools.description: Get page state summary (URL, title, element count). Use compact=false for full element list

tools.name: browser_scroll
tools.description: Scroll the page up or down by one viewport height

tools.name: browser_go_back
tools.description: Navigate back to the previous page in browser history

tools.name: browser_list_tabs
tools.description: List all open browser tabs with their URLs and titles

tools.name: browser_switch_tab
tools.description: Switch to a different tab by its index

tools.name: browser_close_tab
tools.description: Close a specific tab by its index

tools.name: browser_get_text
tools.description: Get page content as clean markdown text. Efficient alternative to screenshots for reading content

tools.name: browser_grep
tools.description: Search page text with regex or string pattern. Returns matching lines with context like grep

tools.name: browser_search_elements
tools.description: Search interactive DOM elements by text, tag, id, class, or attribute. Returns indices for click/type

tools.name: browser_find_and_scroll
tools.description: Find text on the page and scroll to it for navigation

tools.name: browser_get_accessibility_tree
tools.description: Get the page accessibility tree. Supports format='tree' (nested, default) or 'flat' (array with parent_id). Use max_depth to limit depth. Returns total_nodes and total_nodes_in_page

tools.name: browser_execute_js
tools.description: Execute JavaScript in the page context and return the result. Set await_promise=false for fire-and-forget scripts

prompts.name: scrape_data
prompts.description: Extract structured data from a website
prompts.text: Use browser_navigate to go to {url}, then use browser_get_text to get page content as markdown. Use browser_grep to search for {data_type}. If the page requires interaction, use browser_get_state to find elements and browser_click/browser_type as needed.

prompts.name: fill_form
prompts.description: Fill out and submit a web form
prompts.text: Navigate to {url}, use browser_get_state to identify form fields, then use browser_type to fill in: {field_data}. Finally, click the submit button.

prompts.name: research_topic
prompts.description: Research a topic across multiple websites
prompts.text: Open multiple tabs using browser_navigate with new_tab=true for sites: {sites}. Use browser_get_text on each to gather information about {topic}. Switch between tabs with browser_switch_tab.

workspace_directory.title: Workspace Directory
workspace_directory.description: Directory to use as workspace for downloads and file operations

headless.title: Headless Mode
headless.description: Run browser without GUI (faster but no visual feedback). Set to false to see the browser in action

stealth.title: Stealth Mode
stealth.description: Use stealth mode to avoid detection by anti-bot systems

user_data_dir.title: User Data Directory
user_data_dir.description: Chrome profile directory for persistent sessions (cookies, localStorage, etc)

disable_security.title: Disable Security
disable_security.description: Disable browser security features (CORS, CSP, etc). Use with caution

deterministic_rendering.title: Deterministic Rendering
deterministic_rendering.description: Force deterministic rendering for consistent screenshots. May break some sites

viewport_expansion.title: Viewport Expansion
viewport_expansion.description: Extra pixels to expand viewport for better LLM context understanding

allowed_domains.title: Allowed Domains
allowed_domains.description: Comma-separated list of domains the browser can access (e.g., 'example.com,*.google.com'). Leave empty for no restrictions

sensitive_data_masking.title: Sensitive Data Masking
sensitive_data_masking.description: Mask sensitive data (passwords, credit cards) in screenshots and logs

default_timeout.title: Default Timeout (ms)
default_timeout.description: Default timeout for browser operations in milliseconds

wait_between_actions.title: Wait Between Actions (seconds)
wait_between_actions.description: Time to wait between browser actions for stability

session_timeout.title: Session Timeout (minutes)
session_timeout.description: Minutes of inactivity before browser session auto-closes
